body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky --

Your humble petitioners would respectfully represent that at the April Term of the Wayne Circuit Court 1865 Charles Daugherty and Alexander H Brown were indicted for the offence of Gaming, and in pursuance of Said indictment Confessed judgment for Twenty Dollars each at the October term 1865 of Said Court --

They further State the Specific act for which they were indicted was Playing for Home made Sugar at Mill Springs Ky, and that some three or four months previous to the rendition of the above fine inflicted against them, they had formed a resolution to forever abandon the practice of gaming, and have up to this time Strictly Conformed to this resolution --

In view of which facts they respectfully petition his Excellency byto the power vested in him as Executive, to remit those fines as far as is practicable
Mill Springs Ky Dec 22 1865

Respectfully
C Daugherty
A H Brown
We whose names are hereunto subscribed endorse the foregoing Statements as true

James Denny
T V West
F I Dunnigan
James Ruck
George West --
Harry Sloan Sr
Burr Castello
J. Smith Frisbie
Wm H Brown
Elihu Taylor

Wayne Cir Ct
vs
Alex H Brown & Chas Dougherty
$20, each
Remitted 26 Dec /65
